speaker: Frasier
text: A gold leaf candle snuffer?  Huh.  My, what a spendthrift this Charles the Tenth was.  Well of course I want you to bid on it for me, Greg, so start waving your paddle!

speaker: Roz
text: Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, you got my message!

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, you said you had good news.  What's up?

speaker: Frasier
text: More important: What's down?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, fun.  Wordplay.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, the ratings are out for KACL's first six months of all-salsa radio.

speaker: Roz
text: And they were lousy?

speaker: Frasier
text: They aspire to lousy!

speaker: Roz
text: So I guess they'll be looking for a new format.

speaker: Frasier
text: Better yet: an old format!

speaker: Roz
text: What, you think they're gonna bring us back?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the scuttlebutt on the street.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, this is great!  Aren't you thrilled?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd be shouting it from the rooftops if I weren't saving my instrument. _The waitress, Colette, brings Frasier his coffee.  Colette is a perky blonde whose youthful prettiness hides a semi-omnipotent prescience, after the style of Wodehouse's Jeeves._

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Colette
text: May I help you?

speaker: Roz
text: Non-fat capp... Haven't seen you before.  I'm Roz, this is Frasier.

speaker: Colette
text: Colette.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, your mother was a fan of the great French novelist and raconteur Sidonie-Gabriel Colette.

speaker: Colette
text: [_going along_] OK.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, guys, you won't... [_sees Colette_] Whoa!  Any more like you at home?

speaker: Colette
text: No.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Good, we'll have privacy. [_ordering_] Short drip.

speaker: Colette
text: [_introducing_] Colette.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_dropping the magazine on the table and sitting_] Hey, you guys seen these numbers?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Salsa radio is in el dumperacha.

speaker: Frasier
text: See?

speaker: Bulldog
text: KACL is gonna be on their knees begging us to come back to work.

speaker: Roz
text: You know that lady from the temp agency who's always saying I have a bad attitude?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Roz
text: I can't wait to tell that bean-counting fathead where she can put her timesheet!  I'm quitting on the way home!

speaker: Colette
text: [_bringing Roz's coffee_] Ooh...

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  Did you say something?

speaker: Colette
text: No.  No, never mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what?  I better cancel my lecture next week. Can't be out of town if I'm gonna be working.

speaker: Colette
text: [_walking behind them_] Ooh...

speaker: Frasier
text: Is everything all right, Collette?

speaker: Colette
text: Oh, I hate this.

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Colette
text: Well, I overhear things.  I'm not trying to, it just happens when you're a  waitress.

speaker: Roz
text: And you overheard something about KACL?

speaker: Colette
text: They're not dropping salsa.

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: How do you know that?

speaker: Colette
text: Well, the station owner was in this morning and he said "It's my station, and I like salsa music, and I'm sticking with it."  But that could mean anything.

speaker: Roz
text: I knew I shouldn't have gotten my hopes up.

speaker: Bulldog
text: This stinks!  This is total BS!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what are you upset about, Bulldog?  You've got a job.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Not anymore.  I got canned last Friday for somethin' I said on the air.  I was talking to this golfer chick who said she wanted to enter the Women's Open.  Like I'm supposed to leave that alone.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm starting to think we're never going back to work.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now, Roz, they can't stay with a failing format forever. I guarantee you, in three months, if the numbers are this bad, they'll have to make a change.

speaker: Roz
text: Three months is an eternity.  My rent's gone up, the baby stuff costs a fortune.  I stopped buying Alice those little pink headbands they make for little girls whose hair hasn't grown in yet.  Now when I go out, I just call her Howard.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pulling out his checkbook_] Well, Roz, you know what?  If things have gotten that tight, let me lend you some money to tide you over.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh that's very sweet, but I couldn't.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, please, it's not a hardship for me, I'll be fine for the next three months.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I don't know.  I'm not sure I feel comfortable taking money from you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Try putting your hair in a bun.  That used to help Lilith. Now, how much can I give you?

speaker: Roz
text: Fifteen hundred?  I mean, I wouldn't ask for so much, it's just...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, it's none of my business.  You can just pay me back whenever you'd like.  This is your money to do with as you see fit.  There we are. [_Pulls the check out and gives it to her._]

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please, Roz, don't even mention it.  Makes me feel good to share my good fortune with someone.  You know what, I just got a call from my antique scout.  He's found a gilded candle snuffer that the Seattle Museum would pay a pretty penny for to have in their collection.

speaker: Colette
text: [_as she's passing towards another table_] Ooh...

speaker: Frasier
text: I hate her.   **SPA VS. SPA**  _Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Martin is sitting in his chair, holding an ice pack on Eddie's head.  Niles and Frasier come from the kitchen._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry Niles, I have no idea where it is.  I'm not even sure I own one.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, don't be ridiculous, Frasier.  Dad, have you seen Frasier's fritatta pan?

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Marty Crane.  I don't believe we've met.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, what on Earth are you doing?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Eddie's woozy.  There's this vicious blue jay on the terrace that keeps teasing him, then Eddie goes chasing after him, slams into that glass door and this bird just struts around, big as you please, laughing that snooty bird laugh.

speaker: Niles
text: Snooty bird laugh? [_He sniggers._]

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, like that.

speaker: Martin
text: I want to put stick-ems on the door so Eddie remembers it's glass.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, Dad!  By al means, let's add rainbow decals to the nose prints and the bits of fur that already festoon it!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you're pretty grouchy for someone who just got his job back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe that's because I'm not getting my job back!

speaker: Martin
text: What happened?  You said it was a sure thing this morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well it wasn't!  I spoke with Bebe, she confirmed that they're keeping salsa.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well don't despair, Dad.  There are other jobs.  Bebe told me that I'm on the short list for the voice of Chester, the Yummy-Nuts Squirrel.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right.  Don't anyone go out in this weather.  I am so soaked, my dress is pasted right on me.  It's a good thing I had this coat in the trunk.  _Niles puts down his glass and walks around behind her grabbing her collar._

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, that was lucky.  Let me take it for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, it's all right.  I'll keep it on for the moment, thanks. Here you are, Dr. Crane, I stopped off at the Tre Anom Day Spa and picked up your papaya exfoliant and your neck cream por aloe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Daphne.  I wouldn't have sent you out in this weather if it weren't an emergency.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, by the way, I saw Roz down at the spa, having herself an all-day beauty treatment.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, that's strange.

speaker: Martin
text: Why?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Roz has been a little cash poor lately.  In fact, I gave her a loan myself this morning.  Then she heads down to the Tre Anom.  You know, I have half a mind to have a word with her about it.

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, bad idea.  You loaned her that money, it's hers now. It's not yours and it's none of your business what she does with it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's exactly what I told her, but still...

speaker: Martin
text: Now, trust me.  More friendships have been ruined because of something like this.  Smartest thing you can do is never bring it up.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm aware of that, Dad, it's just she must have gone straight from the cafe down to the spa!  Don't you think that's odd?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, not when you stack it up against a man who uses neck cream.

speaker: Niles
text: Before you mock this product, you might recall you went to this spa.

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: Don't you remember?  Two years ago.  For your birthday I gave you that special gift certificate for you and Sherry to have a day of indulgence.  You told me you used it.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah.  Right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Remind us, Dad, what treatments did you have?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, we got the whole shootin' match.  First, they rubbed us all over, and then they uh, they washed us down with this liniment oil, and then they hit us with those hickory sticks.

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake, you've heard us talk about it enough, you'd think you'd be able to bluff a little better than that.

speaker: Martin
text: You'd be surprised at what I don't listen to.  I'm sorry, Niles, I hope you're not mad.

speaker: Niles
text: Mad?  No, I'm delighted!  If you still have the certificate, we can go together.

speaker: Martin
text: Nah, I don't think so.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, please, I need this.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, a spa's just not my speed.  I just keep picturing myself standing over some drain being hosed down like some old circus animal.

speaker: Niles
text: But, Dad, I can't afford this sort of thing for myself anymore.  I, I'd go without you but the certificate's in your name.  Please?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all right.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, great!  I'm going to go make a reservation before you change your mind.

speaker: Martin
text: [_getting up_] And what are you smirking at?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm just musing about the timeless moments that bind a father to a son.  Game of catch, trip to a fishing hole, shared rain forest mud facial.   _Scene 3 - Cafe Nervosa. Fade in.  Frasier is sitting at a table, Niles comes in._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Niles, I thought today was your spa day.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting_] It is, I'm on my way, and I need it now more than ever.  Last night, at the Shangri-La, the most scandalous thing happened...

speaker: Frasier
text: Now's not the best time.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, sorry, I didn't see you there.  I'll have...

speaker: Colette
text: A non-fat cappuccino?

speaker: Niles
text: Good guess!

speaker: Colette
text: No, I've waited on you before.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't think so, I'm very observant.

speaker: Niles
text: Anyway, I was invited to a housewarming party for a new arrival, Stuey.  I hadn't been there two minutes when I heard a pop.  I looked up, there was the '81 Chateau Haut Brion I brought being decanted into a punch bowl of sangria, canned fruit and erotic ice cubes.  I haven't been so depressed since Maris started seeing what's-his-name.

speaker: Colette
text: [_bringing his coffee_] Schenkman.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Colette
text: Uh-huh.  _She walks away, Niles freezes a moment in thought.  Roz comes in carrying some bags._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz.

speaker: Niles
text: Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Shopping really takes it out of you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Stocking up on supplies for baby Alice?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, no, it's Momma's turn today.  Back in a minute.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bidwell's?!  My God, isn't that a little pricey?

speaker: Niles
text: I'll say, it's Maris's favorite store.  They give points for every dollar you spend there.  One year, she got enough to have Tony Bennett come to our house and sing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well at this rate, she's going to go through that loan in no time.  I'm just wondering if I should have a talk with her.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I understand your impulse, but I'm with Dad on this one. Questioning her about how she's going to spend that money is only going to lead to trouble.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not sure I agree.  Of course the entire point may be moot, anyway.  How do I know there's anything more extravagant in here than calendars and socks... [_He starts to look in the bags._]

speaker: Niles
text: Don't even think about it.  You know as well as I do that there is absolutely no justification for going through her bags.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right, there isn't. [_He takes his keys and throws them in a bag._] Now there is.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Just shut up and keep a lookout! [_looks_] Cashmere sweater?! Bidwell's private label perfume?!

speaker: Niles
text: Here she comes.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_as he sits back down_] My keys!

speaker: Roz
text: That's the last time I wear the shoes right out of the store, my feet are killing me!

speaker: Niles
text: I should go.  I want to get down to the spa before Dad.  He may bridle when the front desk clerk asks him if he prefers a man or a woman.

speaker: Roz
text: Wow, is that the time?  I've got to meet Carol for lunch at La Gallou.

speaker: Frasier
text: La Gallou?  Uh, you know,  Roz, before you go...

speaker: Roz
text: I know, if I drop your name, they'll give me better service.  I'll call you later.

speaker: Colette
text: Can I get you anything else?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, a taxi.

speaker: Colette
text: I already called. _Frasier throws some money down and heads for the door.  Fade out.  End of Act 1  Act 2_  **A MOVEABLE FACE**  _Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Frasier is decanting wine and spills some._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, damn!

speaker: Daphne
text: Not to worry, Dr. Crane, I'll have that spot cleaned up in no time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: Lock up your daughters, the men are back from the hunt!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, boys, how was your day at the spa?

speaker: Niles
text: Fantastic.  You should have seen Dad.  I walked by the serenity room just as Olga and Sergei were giving him a full-body sudsing.

speaker: Martin
text: I never felt so clean and so dirty at the same time.

speaker: Niles
text: See you later, Dad.  Great day!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, how bad was it?

speaker: Niles
text: Mortifying!  First of all, he refused to go nude, even in the private rooms.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sitting on the couch_] Well, Niles, don't forget: Dad is of a different generation.

speaker: Niles
text: Wearing socks and underpants and carrying a wallet into a mud bath is not a generational issue.  If you ever hear me offer to take Dad to a spa again, wash out my mouth with jug wine.

speaker: Niles
text: Did you ever get your keys back from Roz?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  Actually, I had to wait the entire day before she found them in her bag.  She's on her way over right now, gives me a chance to talk to her about her spending.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, why do you insist on traipsing into that minefield?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I don't want to talk to her about it, I have to.  At the rate she's spending, she's going to be out of money before we're back to work.  And frankly, I'm just a little bit annoyed at how she keeps flaunting it in my face.  Expensive lunches, needless extravagances.  Frankly I think the entire thing's just a bit insensitive, don't you?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_getting up from scrubbing_] Excuse me, not to interrupt, but six months ago you borrowed forty dollars from me.  We were at the wine shop, remember?  You couldn't quite scrape together enough for a bottle of your precious Chateau Mr. Fussy-Pants? So I lent you the money.  And have I said a peep about it since?  No!  I just sit here quietly reusing my tea bags while you trundle off to your private clubs ordering gourmet this and imported that!  "Are the cigars Cuban?"  "Are the Tulips Dutch?"  "Oh, good news: my personal shopper just found a dozen antique pudding plates."  Who has twelve people over for pudding?!  So you gave poor Roz a bit of money!  It hasn't changed your life, has it, you sherry-swilling, foie gras- munching hypocrite?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne?  I did repay you.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_turning_] What?

speaker: Frasier
text: I paid for that parking ticket.  Fifty dollars as I recall. It means you owe me ten.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, right.  Well, I'm glad you said something.   It's not good to let these things fester.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, I think I'm having a weird reaction to that spa stuff. My skin's startin' to tingle and tighten up.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that's the citrus reacting with your natural oils.  It's a good sign.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it doesn't feel so good, I just scratched my chin and my eyelid closed.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that'll be Roz.  Maybe I'll take my leave before the fur starts to fly.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Niles, there's not going to be any fur flying.  Unless of course she bought one on the way over here.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you on the way out?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, good night. [_He leaves._]

speaker: Roz
text: Here are your keys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Roz.  We had to turn the whole cafe inside out looking for them.

speaker: Roz
text: I would have been here a lot sooner, but I stopped to get you something.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, Roz, gosh, you know, you really shouldn't have.

speaker: Roz
text: I wanted to.  This is just my way of saying "Thank you" for how great you've been.

speaker: Frasier
text: But, you see, you really shouldn't have.  I mean, for one thing, it's just...

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, it is lovely, [_It is a crystal decanter._] Roz, it's just that... Listen, there's something I really need to talk to you about...

speaker: Roz
text: Now, that decanter is not just to say "Thank you."  It's also to say "Congratulations!"  The station manager called me half an hour ago, I made him promise he'd let me tell you.  The board has reconsidered, they're changing formats, they're bringing us back!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well Roz!  That's fantastic!

speaker: Roz
text: We start tomorrow!

speaker: Martin
text: What's goin' on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Good news, Dad, good news!  We got our jobs back at KACL!

speaker: Martin
text: [_his face completely flat_] Oh, great.  Congratulations.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I thought we'd at least get smile out of you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_worried and putting a hand to his face_] I thought I was smiling.  _Fade out.  Scene 2 - The Radio Station. Fade in.  In the booth, the salsa DJ (Jorge) is finishing his last show as he and his producer look depressed.  People can be seen in the hall behind them, happy._

speaker: Jorge
text: ...._Adios amigos.  Adios, KACL, adios._  _Cut to the hallway outside the booth.  All the old talk radio people are there, happy and celebrating._

speaker: Bulldog
text: This is so great, we're all back together again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, Noel!  Good to see you.  What you been up to?

speaker: Noel
text: Well, actually, I never left.  _Yo hablo Espanol._ [_to an unhappy woman_] _Adios, Maria._

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, everybody!

speaker: All
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Isn't this the best?  It's so great to see everyone.  Bulldog and Noel and Frasier and... [_to a woman she doesn't recognize_] you.

speaker: Bulldog
text: God, I didn't think I'd ever see this place again.  It's like we're soldiers comin' back from the war. _He grabs a passing woman and bends her back for a kiss in the classic sailor/nurse pose from Times Square at the end of WWII.  When he lets her up, she slaps him and walks away._

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_throwing his arms up_] I'm home!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, as much as I'd like to continue this celebration, in three minutes, we have a show to do. Come on, Roz, let's go!

speaker: Frasier
text: Noel?

speaker: Noel
text: Oh, I just wanted to say I missed you most of all, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, thanks Noel, that's so sweet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that certainly is sweet, Noel, off you go.

speaker: Noel
text: Me, nothin' much has changed.  Still live with my mom. Still working on that Klingon-to-English dictionary.

speaker: Frasier
text: Noel, how do you say goodbye in Klingon?

speaker: Noel
text: Oh, it depends.  If you're talking to a superior officer, then...

speaker: Frasier
text: Noel!

speaker: Noel
text: _Krish-krush._ [_leaves_]

speaker: Roz
text: I am so thrilled to be back!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God, so am I!  Roz, you know I couldn't get a wink of sleep last night.  But I put the time to good use though, I composed a little speech to open today's show.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, that's great.  You know, as I was falling asleep last night, it occurred to me that you wanted to talk to me about something.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Right, oh, well, it was just, I just had a little bone to pick with you, but it's gone by the wayside now.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, absolutely.  You know how thing's are when you're out of work.  You know you just get a little crazy about little stuff.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, tell me about it.  Money things alone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, as a matter of fact...

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, it's not an issue anymore, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Come on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right.  It's just that I thought the way you were, uh, spending money was a little unwise.  You know, spa days, expensive lunches, Bidwell's perfume?  I, I just thought, you know, you were unemployed... But, you know what?  You're employed now, so there it is.  End of subject, I won't even bring it up again.

speaker: Roz
text: I never told you I bought that perfume.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmmm?  Well, I, I... you didn't have to, I can smell it on you.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm not wearing any.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're kidding.  My goodness, is that you?  Well then you should sweat into bottles.  We've got a show to do.

speaker: Roz
text: The only way you could know that is if you were looking through my shopping ba... the keys!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, you know, we really should be setting up.

speaker: Roz
text: I can't believe this!  You were searching through my bags? What, is this about the loan?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  Fine.  I gave you fifteen hundred dollars and suddenly you were off on a spending spree.

speaker: Roz
text: Excuse me, but weren't you the one that said I could spend it any way I wanted?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I just thought you were going to be a little more responsible than that!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, so now I'm irresponsible?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, I'm just saying that a woman in your situation...

speaker: Roz
text: What situation?  Oh, I know what this is all about, my baby.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: That's what all this irresponsible stuff is.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that is not what I meant.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, listen, obviously I am not to be trusted with your precious money, so I'm paying you back.  And not that it's any of your business, but Carol took me out to La Gallou, and my mother gave me a day at the spa, and those shoes were a store credit.  Oh, and I bought the perfume.  That was just for me, because I wanted it. [_She hands him the check._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I'm sorry.  I didn't mean to say any of those things.

speaker: Roz
text: Too late.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, I can't stand to have you mad at me.  Look, let me take you to dinner tonight, we can discuss it afterward.

speaker: Roz
text: You're on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: No.  You're on in five seconds.  _Frasier rushes back to his seat, puts his headphones on and begins on Roz's cue._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good afternoon Seattle, this is Dr. Frasier Crane and we're back.  But don't worry, I may have been gone a while, but I think I remember how all these knobs and buttons work. _He hits a switch and salsa music blares out.  He hurriedly hits it again and it stops._

speaker: Frasier
text: I see they've moved the cough button.  Well, anyway, I composed some thoughts last night about what this show has meant to me in the last years, and well, I'd like to share it with you now. I realized I have a lot to feel grateful for; grateful for my listeners who trusted me with their problems; and grateful for the person whom I most trust.  It's not an exaggeration to say I put my career in this woman's hands every day.

speaker: Frasier
text: And she never lets me down.  She shoulders many responsibilities here, and in her personal life, with a grace and skill I admire more than she'll ever know.  I'm proud to call her my friend: my producer, Roz Doyle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, now, on to the show.  If I'm a bit rusty, I hope you'll into your hearts...

speaker: Roz
text: All right, Frasier, you're forgiven.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good!  Well, we've got a quick word from our sponsor, and then we'll be back with your calls.  Back after this.

speaker: Roz
text: [_coming to the door_] Thanks, Frasier.  I'm sorry I got so mad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, you had every right to.  How could I think you would ever squander the money I gave you that way?  You'd never be that irresponsible.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, of course I wouldn't.  But if it was on your mind, I'm glad you brought it up. I like that we can always be honest with each other.

speaker: Frasier
text: I like that, too.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm so touched that you stayed up all night last night and wrote all those things about me.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_kissing her hand_] I meant every word.  _They go back to their stations.  Noel comes in on Frasier's side, Bulldog on Roz's._

speaker: Noel
text: Hey, Dr. Crane.  Great speech.  I love what you said about Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Noel.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey Bulldog, can you loan me some money?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Sure, how much?

speaker: Roz
text: Fifteen hundred.  I just wrote a bad check.

speaker: Noel
text: [_reading Frasier's speech_] Hey, wait a minute.  There's nothing in here about Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Noel, put that down.

speaker: Noel
text: "Like Napoleon's triumphant return from Elba.."

speaker: Frasier
text: [_snatches the paper_] _Krish-krush, krish-krush!_ _Noel leaves, Frasier and Roz take their places, and she cues him again. Fade out._
